text: Kim Do-Keun (born 2 March 1972) is a South Korean professional athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team.National-Football_teams.com, "Kim Do-Keun"; retrieved 2012-9-4. == Career statistics == === Club statistics === Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Continental Continental Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Korea Republic Korea Republic Korea Republic League League FA Cup FA Cup League Cup League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 1995 Chunnam Dragons K-League 9 0 — 1 0 — 10 0 1996 29 9 ? ? 7 1 — 1997 9 2 ? ? 12 5 — 1998 18 6 ? ? 2 0 ? ? 1999 18 2 ? ? 7 0 ? ? 2000 2 0 ? ? 9 5 — Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup J.League Cup J.League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2000 Verdy Kawasaki J1 League 14 0 2 0 4 1 — 20 1 2001 Cerezo Osaka 13 0 0 0 2 0 — 15 0 Korea Republic Korea Republic Korea Republic League League FA Cup FA Cup League Cup League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2001 Chunnam Dragons K-League 3 0 ? ? 0 0 — 2002 25 3 ? ? 5 0 — 2003 41 1 4 0 - — 45 1 2004 5 0 0 0 0 0 — 5 0 2005 0 0 0 0 4 0 — 4 0 2005 Suwon Samsung Bluewings 12 0 1 0 0 0 ? ? 2006 Gyeongnam FC 14 0 3 0 9 0 — 26 0 Country Korea Republic Korea Republic 185 23 56 11 Country Japan Japan 27 0 2 0 6 1 — 35 1 Total Total Total 212 23 ===National team statistics=== Korea Republic national team Korea Republic national team Korea Republic national team Year Apps Goals 1993 2 0 1994 0 0 1995 0 0 1996 0 0 1997 4 1 1998 11 0 1999 1 0 2000 1 0 2001 1 0 2002 1 0 2003 1 0 Total 22 1 ===International goals=== :Results list South Korea's goal tally first.
